org.flowvisor.api

Interface FVUserAPI

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    FVUserAPIJSON, FVUserAPIXML
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    FVUserAPIImpl, FVUserAPIJSONImpl, FVUserAPIXMLRPCImpl

    public interface FVUserAPI

      java.lang.String getSliceStats(java.lang.String sliceName)
      Return a multiline string of the slice's stats The string is of the form: ---SENT--- $switch1 :: $type1=$count1[,$type2=$count2[...]] $switch2 :: $type1=$count1[,$type2=$count2[...]] Total :: $type1=$count1[,$type2=$count2[...]] ---DROP--- $switch1 :: $type1=$count1[,$type2=$count2[...]] $switch2 :: $type1=$count1[,$type2=$count2[...]] Total :: $type1=$count1[,$type2=$count2[...]]

      java.lang.String getSwitchStats(java.lang.String dpidStr)
      Return a multiline string of the switch's stats The string is of the form: ---SENT--- $slice1 :: $type1=$count1[,$type2=$count2[...]] $slice2 :: $type1=$count1[,$type2=$count2[...]] Total :: $type1=$count1[,$type2=$count2[...]] ---DROP--- $slice1 :: $type1=$count1[,$type2=$count2[...]] $slice2 :: $type1=$count1[,$type2=$count2[...]] Total :: $type1=$count1[,$type2=$count2[...]]

      • createSlice

        java.lang.Boolean createSlice(java.lang.String sliceName,
                            java.lang.String passwd,
                            java.lang.String controller_url,
                            java.lang.String drop_policy,
                            java.lang.String slice_email)
                              throws MalformedControllerURL,
                                     InvalidSliceName,
                                     InvalidDropPolicy,
                                     PermissionDeniedException,
                                     DuplicateControllerException
        Create a new slice (without flowspace)
        Parameters:
        sliceName -
        passwd - Cleartext! FIXME
        controller_url - Reference controller pseudo-url, e.g., tcp:hostname[:port]
        drop_policy - Currently takes either 'exact' or 'rule', defines the drop policy for a slice when the controller is off-line.
        slice_email - As a contract for the slice
        Returns:
        success
        Throws:
        InvalidSliceName
        PermissionDeniedException
        DuplicateControllerException
        MalformedControllerURL
        InvalidDropPolicy

        Get information about a device
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        a map of key=value pairs where the value may itself be a more complex object

        DPIDNotFound

      • getLinks

        java.util.Collection<java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> getLinks()
        Get the list of links between the devices in getDevices() Links are directional, so switch1 --> switch2 does not imply the reverse; they will be both listed if the link is bidirectional
        Returns:

      • deleteSlice

        java.lang.Boolean deleteSlice(java.lang.String sliceName)
                              throws SliceNotFound,
                                     PermissionDeniedException,
                                     ConfigError
        Delete the named slice Requestor only has permission to delete its own slice or the slice that it (transitively) created. Since root has transitively created all slices, root can delete all slices.
        Parameters:
        sliceName -
        Returns:
        Success
        Throws:
        ConfigError
        {@link - SliceNotFound}, PermissionDeniedException
        SliceNotFound
        PermissionDeniedException

      • setFloodPerm

        java.lang.Boolean setFloodPerm(java.lang.String dpidStr,
                             java.lang.String floodPerm)
                               throws PermissionDeniedException
        Set the flood permission for a switch
        Parameters:
        dpidStr - 8 colon separated hex bytes, e..g., "00:00:00:00:00:00:00:01"
        floodPerm - slice which is allowed to flood this switch.
        Returns:
        true on success, false on failure
        Throws:
        PermissionDeniedException

      • setMaximumFlowMods

        boolean setMaximumFlowMods(java.lang.String sliceName,
                         java.lang.String dpid,
                         java.lang.String maxFlowMods)
                           throws PermissionDeniedException
        Set the maximum number of flow mods per slice per dpid. If dpid is set to any then the global slice limit applies. If no value is set then the number of slices is limitless.
        Parameters:
        sliceName - - slice to apply the limit to.
        dpid - - dpid to apply limit to
        maxFlowMods - - the limit
        Returns:
        Throws:
        PermissionDeniedException

      • getMaximumFlowMods

        java.lang.Integer getMaximumFlowMods(java.lang.String sliceName,
                                   java.lang.String dpid)
                                     throws PermissionDeniedException
        Get the maximum per slice per dpid limit.
        Parameters:
        sliceName -
        dpid -
        Returns:
        the limit or -1 if there is not limit.
        Throws:
        PermissionDeniedException

      • registerTopologyChangeCallback

        java.lang.Boolean registerTopologyChangeCallback(java.lang.String URL,
                                               java.lang.String methodName,
                                               java.lang.String cookie)
                                                 throws java.net.MalformedURLException
        Register an XMLRPC URL to be called when the topology changes. When the topology changes, FV will make a XMLRPC call to URL with parameter "cookie"
        Parameters:
        URL - XMLRPC Address/proceedure
        cookie - opaque string with some meaningful state from the caller
        Returns:
        success on registering the callback
        Throws:
        java.net.MalformedURLException

      • getTopologyCallback

        java.lang.String getTopologyCallback()

      • unregisterTopologyChangeCallback

        java.lang.Boolean unregisterTopologyChangeCallback()
        Unregister a previously registered callback
        Returns:
        true if successful, false otherwise

      • getSliceStats

        java.lang.String getSliceStats(java.lang.String sliceName)
                               throws SliceNotFound,
                                      PermissionDeniedException
        Return a multiline string of the slice's stats The string is of the form: ---SENT--- $switch1 :: $type1=$count1[,$type2=$count2[...]] $switch2 :: $type1=$count1[,$type2=$count2[...]] Total :: $type1=$count1[,$type2=$count2[...]] ---DROP--- $switch1 :: $type1=$count1[,$type2=$count2[...]] $switch2 :: $type1=$count1[,$type2=$count2[...]] Total :: $type1=$count1[,$type2=$count2[...]]
        Parameters:
        sliceName - which slice do you wants stats for
        Returns:
        A string of the above form
        Throws:
        SliceNotFound
        PermissionDeniedException

      • getSwitchStats

        java.lang.String getSwitchStats(java.lang.String dpidStr)
                                throws DPIDNotFound,
                                       PermissionDeniedException
        Return a multiline string of the switch's stats The string is of the form: ---SENT--- $slice1 :: $type1=$count1[,$type2=$count2[...]] $slice2 :: $type1=$count1[,$type2=$count2[...]] Total :: $type1=$count1[,$type2=$count2[...]] ---DROP--- $slice1 :: $type1=$count1[,$type2=$count2[...]] $slice2 :: $type1=$count1[,$type2=$count2[...]] Total :: $type1=$count1[,$type2=$count2[...]]
        Parameters:
        dpid - of the switchyou wants stats for
        Returns:
        A string of the above form
        Throws:
        DPIDNotFound
        PermissionDeniedException
